words.def: impose something unpleasant
a hard kind of stone
sanctioned by custom or morality especially sexual morality
the act of giving temporary assistance
a sudden quick movement
The currency of Peru between 1985 and 1991, replacing the sol.
fine ravellings of cotton or linen fibers
A Nordic dairy product, similar to yoghurt, but using different bacteria which give a different taste and texture.
the cardinal number that is the sum of four and one
a display of bad temper
County/City (Proper noun)
a local and habitual twitching especially in the face
a silvery malleable metallic element that resists corrosion
a luminance unit equal to 1 candle per square meter measured perpendicular to the rays from the source
a quantity of no importance
the humanistic study of a body of literature
United States sculptor and architect whose public works include the memorial to veterans of the Vietnam War in Washington (born in 1959)
An uncertainty, possibility, condition, doubt etc.
a unit of length equal to one twelfth of a foot
a light strong grey lustrous corrosion-resistant metallic element used in strong lightweight alloys (as for airplane parts)
a soft silver-white univalent element of the alkali metal group
the branch of engineering that deals with the use of computers and telecommunications to retrieve and store and transmit information
